body.name: Ascendance of a Bookworm: Part 4 Volume 6
body.description: With the advancement ceremony and fellowship gatherings complete, Rozemyne’s new year at the Royal Academy can properly begin. She goes on another library-inspired rampage and pushes the other Ehrenfest second-years to finish their classes on the first day, all while hunting for new allies to recruit into her Library Committee.Somehow, Rozemyne manages to cause even more problems, and in quicker succession than the year before. She spends more time with the professors, the archduke candidates from top-ranking duchies, and even the Sovereignty’s third prince, much to her guardians’ displeasure. But as they agonize over interduchy diplomacy, Rozemyne blazes ahead on her own path. She charges forward with unbending focus and even hunts a ternisbefallen feybeast that shows up in Ehrenfest’s gathering spot!This is the newest volume of this biblio-fantasy wherein the book-obsessed protagonist can’t quite catch a break. Includes two original short stories and four-panel manga by You Shiina!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Rozemyne being agoof like usual
reviews.reviewText: Don't mind her doing things she shouldn't. It's fiiine, everything is fiiine

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Be sure to read the epilogue
reviews.reviewText: I'm not going to spoil a thing. But I will say that I'm upset at those sovereign people and I can't wait to see what Rosemyne does in the next book. I will be waiting on the side of that very steep cliff. (since it's a cliffhanger no cliffs involved in the story.) So much so I'm contemplating buying them in Japanese and learning how to read them. At least then I can hold them all in my hands while I lament my decision. I guess I'll have to read them all over from the beginning again while I wait. Two thumbs way up.Tiny spoilerPs. That line about mana was super racy even before I found out the definition. ;)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Rosemyne has continued her journey. She tried, in her opinion, to attend her second year at the royal academy without causing problems. She created many instead.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just keeps getting better and better
reviews.reviewText: This story is fantastic. I'm still loving the academy arc and feel it's the best part so far. This time I especially loved the epilogue from Sylvester point of view. It was laugh out loud funny seeing the comparison of the reports and how completely clueless Myne is. It also showed us he really considers her his kid and cares about her, and how much he cares about Ferdinand. I am so excited for the next book!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2022
reviews.reviewText: There have been signs that indicate we are leading up to something, and this book finally announced it.But we still don’t quite know what it is. I have just been looking at a lot of loose threads needing to be gathered and tidied.I applaud kazuki for the deep lore of the world as well as the amazing way it is all brought forth.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Another ‘Peaceful’ year of classes
reviews.reviewText: Which is to say utter chaos. The students show off their studies during tests, And Rosemyne demonstrates her prowess as a walking, talking, and utterly confounding ball of unstoppable chaos. Our bookworm is going to need a dictionary before this year of classes is done, as she seems to have forgotten what ‘peaceful’ means.I’m loving this book - characters are themselves deep, and prone to being themselves in ways that demonstrate chaos.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good Book with All of Rozmyne's (Mis)adventures
reviews.reviewText: Rozemyne has proceded in the Academy in Year 2.And a lot has happened. So much, that her guardians are again left with their heads aching and blood pressure rising.Enjoyable read, not so much controvery which like the last parts.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great continuation of the series
reviews.reviewText: Myne's 2nd year at school starts for real. Much like the previous year, things do not go as planned. New magic is learned, old lore rediscovered and disasters averted. Myne being worried sick when Ferdinand did not scold her at a point where she very much expected to be so was rather funny. The short stories at the end are great as well, in that they show how Myne is somewhat of an unreliable narrator. If I have one complaint, it is that there is clearly something going on behind the scenes, something that is not nearly as simple as a hostile neighbouring duchy, but things progress very slowly in that regards which at times leaves me wondering whether something is a plot hole, a red herring or something that the author is going to answer in the future. I don't mind slice-of-life, but at times I do wish a bit more progress in the plot.

Para aqueles que não conhecem: cuidado, a série é viciante.Mais um volume magnifico de Ascendence of a Bookworm. Não tenho nem muito o que dizer, quem chegou até esse volume sabe bem que essa é uma Light Novel apaixonante.
The book was very interesting.A bit short toy liking but it was good enough. I can't wait for the next one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Beste Fantasy Geschichte auch für nicht Anime Fans
reviews.reviewText: Es ist einfach eine wahnsinnig gute Story und auch abwechslungsreich.Empfohlen auch schon an nicht Anime/Manga Fans und sie lieben es!

reviews.reviewTitle: Rozemyne causing absolute chaos once again
reviews.reviewText: This book had incredibly funny moments, with Rozemyne doing what she does best: sowing the seeds of chaos in her path. When people get used to her antics, she surpass herself to make it even more unpredictable than usual.I'm pretty sure that calling her the Saint of Erenfest is inappropriate, the Saint daughter of the Goddess of Chaos would be a lot better, and we love her for it!
